pageContext.claim: “Al Capone was never placed in solitary confinement. El Chapo, I don't think was placed in solitary confinement. But Paul Manafort was put in solitary confinement.”
pageContext.analysis: Though decades apart, both Capone and Manafort have benefited from “VIP accommodations.” Capone may have had cigars, but Manafort has laptop access. Moreover, Manafort isn't in what one might recognize as solitary confinement, rather he is in as “private, self-contained living unit” that was larger than other units, which included a bathroom, shower, telephone, and laptop access, according to court records.
